On 14 May 2009, at 15:45, David Saff wrote:
> Let me take this in a different direction.  I've wanted, for a while,
> to be able to say
>
> assertThat(list).isEmpty();
>
> Using imposterization, this is possible to write, and gives the
> wonderful bonus that failure messages can be hamcrest-level
> informative, like:
>
> Expected: x.isEmpty()
> Actual: x = [a, b, c]


in the new candidate version of Hamcrest, try

assertThat(list, is(empty());

gives

java.lang.AssertionError:
Expected: is an empty collection
      got: <[one, three]>


Not completely English, but close
